CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Lithiation of alkylated thiophene followed by quenching with tri-butyltin chloride afforded tri-butyl(4alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane ( 10-13 ).

Let's think step by step.

1. Lithiation of alkylated thiophene: This step involves the process of making a thiophene compound reactive by adding a lithium ion. The entity "alkylated thiophene" is the material being lithiated.

2. Tri-butyl(4-alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane (10-13): This is the final product of the reaction. The entities "tri-butyl" and "stannane" are the groups attached to the "4-alkylthiophene-2-yl" core. "Thiophene" is the name of the heterocyclic ring present in the compound.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Alkylated thiophene |
| Tri-butyl(4-alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane (10-13) |
| Thiophene |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Lithiation of alkylated thiophene followed by quenching with tri-butyltin chloride afforded tri-butyl(4alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane ( 10-13 ).

Let's think step by step.

1. Lithiation of alkylated thiophene: This is a chemical reaction where lithiation (the process of making a compound more reactive by adding lithium) is taking place on an alkylated thiophene. Alkylated thiophene is the property name of the compound undergoing the lithiation reaction.

2. tri-butyl(4-alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane (10-13): This is the name of the compound that is formed after the lithiation reaction is followed by quenching with tri-butyltin chloride. The compound name consists of three parts:
   a. tri-butyl: This is the name of the group attached to the stannane (tin) atom. It is composed of three butyl groups.
   b. (4-alkylthiophene-2-yl): This is the name of the group attached to the stannane atom through the quenching reaction. It is a 4-alkylthiophene group, where "4-alkyl" refers to the position of the alkyl group on the thiophene ring, and "thiophene" refers to the type of ring structure.
   c. stannane: This is the name of the functional group that contains the tin atom.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. alkylated thiophene: This is the name of the material undergoing the lithiation reaction.
2. tri-butyl(4-alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane (10-13): This is the name of the material formed after the lithiation reaction and quenching with tri-butyltin chloride.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Lithiation of alkylated thiophene followed by quenching with tri-butyltin chloride afforded tri-butyl(4alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane ( 10-13 ).

Let's think step by step.

1. Lithiation of alkylated thiophene: This is a chemical reaction where lithiation (the process of adding a lithium ion) is performed on alkylated thiophene. Alkylated thiophene is the property value representing the thiophene ring with one or more alkyl groups attached.

2. Quenching with tri-butyltin chloride: This is a chemical reaction where tri-butyltin chloride is used to terminate or "quench" the reaction of lithiation of alkylated thiophene. Tri-butyltin chloride is the property value representing the chemical compound with the formula (Bu3SnCl), where Bu represents butyl group.

3. Tri-butyl(4-alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane (10-13): This is the final product of the reaction between lithiated alkylated thiophene and tri-butyltin chloride. It is a stannane compound with the general formula (Bu3Sn-R-SnBu3), where R represents the alkyl group attached to the thiophene ring. The specific alkyl group is not mentioned in the paragraph, so it is not explicitly stated as a property value, but it is an implicit property value that can be inferred from the context.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. Alkylated thiophene: This is the starting material for the reaction, and it is a property value representing the thiophene ring with one or more alkyl groups attached.

2. Tri-butyltin chloride: This is a reagent used in the reaction, and it is a property value representing the chemical compound with the formula (Bu3SnCl).

3. Tri-butyl(4-alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane (10-13): This is the final product of the reaction, and it is a property value representing a stannane compound with the formula (Bu3Sn-R-SnBu3), where R represents the alkyl group attached to the thiophene ring.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Alkylated thiophene |
| Tri-butyltin chloride |
| Tri-butyl(4-alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane (10-13) |
